title: What can you learn from ancient poop?

multiple-choice.question: What can fossilized poop, also known as coprolites, reveal about ancient humans?

options.label: A
options.text: Only their diet and eating habits

options.label: B
options.text: Only their geographical location and living conditions

options.label: C
options.text: Various aspects of their lives, including diet, geographical location, and cause of death

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing significant about their lives

multiple-choice.question: How can poop be preserved for a long time?

options.label: A
options.text: Only through drying out in caves or desiccated intestines

options.label: B
options.text: Only through creating a cast and mold of the bowel movement

options.label: C
options.text: Through drying out, creating a cast and mold, or mineralization

options.label: D
options.text: Poop cannot be preserved for a long time

multiple-choice.question: What was discovered in the 1000-year-old Viking coprolite found in England?

options.label: A
options.text: A large amount of undigested food

options.label: B
options.text: A high concentration of nutrients

options.label: C
options.text: Tons of intestinal parasites like whipworms

options.label: D
options.text: Evidence of a balanced diet

multiple-choice.question: How did the analysis of Cangrande della Scala's feces contribute to solving the mystery of his death?

options.label: A
options.text: It revealed that he died of natural causes

options.label: B
options.text: It showed that he was poisoned, but the type of poison was unknown

options.label: C
options.text: It found evidence of a poisonous plant and suggested that he drank a poisoned tea

options.label: D
options.text: It did not provide any useful information

multiple-choice.question: What can the contents of coprolites found in Puerto Rico reveal about the native populations that lived there 1-2 millennia ago?

options.label: A
options.text: That they were a single, unified cultural group

options.label: B
options.text: That they were two distinct cultural groups with different diets and parasites

options.label: C
options.text: That they had a highly developed system of sanitation

options.label: D
options.text: That they were expert farmers
